title: 110_hr5523
content: The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" establishes a license fee on internet gambling operators. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose the fee. The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" requires licensed internet gambling operators to pay a 2 percent fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts each month. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue. The Internet gambling license fee is the direct obligation of the operator and cannot be deducted from bet deposits. The term 'Director' is defined as per section 5382 of title 31, US Code. The fee may be treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. "SEC. 6039J. RETURNS OF INTERNET GAMBLING OPERATORS." Every Internet gambling operator subject to section 4491 must provide required information to the Secretary, including the operator's details and those of individuals placing wagers. Maintaining appropriate records is also necessary as per regulations. The information required for tax purposes includes gross winnings, wagers, and losses, tax withheld, account balances, and deposits/withdrawals for each individual. Operators must provide a statement to individuals with their contact details and the information reported to the IRS. Operators must provide a written statement to individuals with their contact details and the information reported to the IRS by January 31 of the following year. The IRS requires Internet gambling operators to report returns under section 6039J, effective for wagers made after December 31, 2008. Additionally, withholding from certain gambling winnings is addressed in section 3. The IRS mandates reporting of Internet gambling returns under section 6039J for wagers made after December 31, 2008. Section 3402(q) is amended to include withholding on net Internet gambling winnings exceeding $5,000 in a calendar year, with no exemption for these winnings. Definitions are also updated to include "proceeds of net Internet gambling winnings." The definition of 'Internet gambling winnings' refers to the net amount withdrawn from an account used for Internet gambling. It includes gross winnings from Internet wagers minus the amount wagered. The terms 'Internet' and 'wager' are defined as per section 5382 of title 31, United States Code. The amendment redefines net Internet gambling winnings as reportable payments, with the operator as payor and the bettor as payee. This change applies to wagers placed after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON NONRESIDENT ALIENS. Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals is amended to include net Internet gambling income. An exemption for certain gambling winnings now includes wagers placed over the Internet. Withholding of tax on nonresident aliens is amended to include gains on transfers. The amendments made by this section apply to wagers placed with a licensee after December 31, 2008, including net Internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year. SEC. 5. TAX ON WAGERS. Amends section 4401 to make persons placing wagers with unlicensed individuals liable for tax. Also amends section 4404 to specify territorial extent. Effective date is after December 31, 2008.
